rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about praise.

Praise is a powerful parenting skill.

If we praise our teens when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about praise.

Praise is a powerful parenting skill.

If we praise our teens when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!

media_title.eng: How will praise help you and your family? Tap play to find out!

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings everyone.

Our topic today is about praise.

It is good to praise our children when they've done good because when we do that, they will do more of that good behavior we want to see.

And let's not forget to praise ourselves when we do good!

rows.media_title: How will praise help you and your family? Tap play to find out!
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings everyone.

Our topic today is about praise.

It is good to praise our children when they've done good because when we do that, they will do more of that good behavior we want to see.

And let's not forget to praise ourselves when we do good!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Praise is an easy way to build your teen’s confidence and strengthen your connection. It really works!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Praise is an easy way to build your teen’s confidence and strengthen your connection. It really works!

media_title.eng: Praise works, but it’s not always easy. Hear how @data.characters.media_female_2.name started using it at home

media_transcript.eng:
When we learnt about this praising thing I thought, “We were never praised for things as teenagers, so why should we start now?” But I got interested when I learnt what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after the weekly workshop, I noticed my teen doing what they do every day: washing the dishes. And I said “Thank you for washing the dishes, my girl, it really makes me happy that you are helping out.” My teen was smiling and she even came to give me a hug, which she never does.

This praising business is hard. I still forget sometimes or give praise at the same time as criticism. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!

rows.media_title: Praise works, but it’s not always easy. Hear how @data.characters.media_female_2.name started using it at home
rows.media_transcript:
When we learnt about this praising thing I thought, “We were never praised for things as teenagers, so why should we start now?” But I got interested when I learnt what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after the weekly workshop, I noticed my teen doing what they do every day: washing the dishes. And I said “Thank you for washing the dishes, my girl, it really makes me happy that you are helping out.” My teen was smiling and she even came to give me a hug, which she never does.

This praising business is hard. I still forget sometimes or give praise at the same time as criticism. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s reflect on our own experience with praise.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s reflect on our own experience with praise.

quiz_1_question.eng:
Think about the last time someone thanked you, or said you did something great.

How did it make you feel?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: We sometimes have to get used to being praised and praising others. That’s okay.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel happy.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That’s great! Being praised often makes us feel proud.

quiz_2_question.eng:
Parents usually do not get thanked or praised enough.

How does it make you feel when nobody says "thank you"?

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Your teen can feel this way too. That's what makes this week's parenting tool simple but important: Praise them for what they do right.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Your teen can feel this way too. That's what makes this week's parenting tool simple but important: Praise them for what they do right.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Your teen can feel this way too. That's what makes this week's parenting tool simple but important: Praise them for what they do right.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Praise really is powerful.

Let’s look at the example of @data.characters.f1_mother.name and her daughters:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Praise really is powerful.

Let’s look at the example of @data.characters.f1_mother.name and her daughters:

text_2.eng: When @data.characters.f1_mother.name is busy, her two daughters often fight. But today, her older daughter actually helped her sister with her schoolwork!

rows.text_2: When @data.characters.f1_mother.name is busy, her two daughters often fight. But today, her older daughter actually helped her sister with her schoolwork!

rows.character_1_text: Thank you for doing your schoolwork, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name, and thank you for helping your sister, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. I'm so proud of you!

character_1_text.eng: Thank you for doing your schoolwork, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name, and thank you for helping your sister, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. I'm so proud of you!

rows.text_1_facilitator: It is time for some questions!

text_1_facilitator.eng: It is time for some questions!

quiz_1_question.eng: How did praise make @data.characters.f1_mother.name's teens feel?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Try again! Praise often creates positive feelings, like feeling happy or proud.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That’s right. Praise made them feel happy and proud!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That’s right. Praise made them feel happy and proud!

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: To get them to do it more often

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng:
All of those things are true!

When her teens are happy, @data.characters.f1_mother.name feels happy. And she got her work done.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: To help her finish her work

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng:
All of those things are true!

When her teens are happy, @data.characters.f1_mother.name feels happy. And she got her work done.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng:
All of those things are true!

When her teens are happy, @data.characters.f1_mother.name feels happy. And she got her work done.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng:
All of those things are true!

When her teens are happy, @data.characters.f1_mother.name feels happy. And she got her work done.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Here are some skills to help you praise your teens.
You can also praise other adults in your household, too. Notice how they respond!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Here are some skills to help you praise your teens.
You can also praise other adults in your household, too. Notice how they respond!

section_1_text.eng: Look for anything your teen does that is helpful or good and praise them for it. They may not show it, but you will see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.

section_2_text.eng: Be enthusiastic – really mean it when you say it!

section_3_text.eng: Try to find something to thank them for every day. Even something really small.

rows.section_1_text: Look for anything your teen does that is helpful or good and praise them for it. They may not show it, but you will see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.
rows.section_2_text: Be enthusiastic – really mean it when you say it!
rows.section_3_text: Try to find something to thank them for every day. Even something really small.

rows.text_1_facilitator: It can be hard to think of reasons to praise your teen! Here are some ideas from other parents:

text_1_facilitator.eng: It can be hard to think of reasons to praise your teen! Here are some ideas from other parents:

text_2.eng:
**Thank you for...**
- Being kind to someone
- Cleaning your room
- Joining a family meal
- Greeting other family members
- Looking after your siblings
- Coming home on time
- Showing thoughtfulness
- Saying 'please' or 'thank you'
- Going to school on time
- Doing chores or schoolwork

rows.text_2:
**Thank you for...**
- Being kind to someone
- Cleaning your room
- Joining a family meal
- Greeting other family members
- Looking after your siblings
- Coming home on time
- Showing thoughtfulness
- Saying 'please' or 'thank you'
- Going to school on time
- Doing chores or schoolwork

rows.text_1_facilitator: This week's home activity is to praise your teen once a day. It will only take 10 seconds!

text_1_facilitator.eng: This week's home activity is to praise your teen once a day. It will only take 10 seconds!

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you praise your teen once a day this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Parents who practise praise at home get better results!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You can do it! Try praising your teen for something simple at first, like looking after their siblings or going to school.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. With time, giving praise will become easier. Try to praise yourself for something first, like "Good job using @global.app_name. It shows you care."

rows.quiz_1_question: Can you praise your teen once a day this week?
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That's great! Parents who practise praise at home get better results!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: You can do it! Try praising your teen for something simple at first, like looking after their siblings or going to school.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That's okay. With time, giving praise will become easier. Try to praise yourself for something first, like "Good job using @global.app_name. It shows you care."

rows.text_1_facilitator: Remember, praise is a powerful tool. The more attention you give to positive behaviour, the more positive behaviour you will see.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Remember, praise is a powerful tool. The more attention you give to positive behaviour, the more positive behaviour you will see.

media_title.eng: Hear from @data.characters.media_daughter_2.name on how it feels to get praise from her mother

media_transcript.eng:
I was grateful that my mother learnt about praise.

My mother always noticed when I was doing something wrong. She would shout at me and hit me.

But when my mother did the workshop, she would praise me for little things. First I thought “What is going on?” but then it continued. I liked it so I did more good things I thought she would like.

It feels great that my mother sees the good things I do, and not just the bad things.

I even said it to her once. During one-on-one time, I said “Thank you, mom, for saying something nice when I do things well, not only when I do things wrong.” This made us both very happy.

rows.media_title: Hear from @data.characters.media_daughter_2.name on how it feels to get praise from her mother
rows.media_transcript:
I was grateful that my mother learnt about praise.

My mother always noticed when I was doing something wrong. She would shout at me and hit me.

But when my mother did the workshop, she would praise me for little things. First I thought “What is going on?” but then it continued. I liked it so I did more good things I thought she would like.

It feels great that my mother sees the good things I do, and not just the bad things.

I even said it to her once. During one-on-one time, I said “Thank you, mom, for saying something nice when I do things well, not only when I do things wrong.” This made us both very happy.
